wikipedia_page.main: Brian Louie Donowa (born 24 September 1964) is an English former professional footballer who played as a Winger. He made nearly 400 appearances for a variety of clubs in the Football League and also played in several other European countries.

response: After a trial with Birmingham City during their Irish tour in the summer of 1991, Hogan signed for the club for a fee of £30,000. He made his debut in the Third Division on 14 December 1991, coming on as substitute for Louie Donowa in a 2–1 defeat away to A.F.C. Bournemouth.Matthews, p. 227. He played only once more for the first team, in the Football League Trophy in January 1992, also as a substitute,Matthews, p. 244. before returning to Cobh Ramblers on loan the following month, and returning to Ireland permanently in September 1992 when he signed for Shamrock Rovers. In the 1993 close season he rejoined Cobh Ramblers, and in 1994 joined College Corinthians.
